entry.tran: (行为或时刻)有重大影响的(常指负面影响)，决定性的
entry.def: If an action or a time when something happened is described as fateful, it is considered to have an important, and often very bad, effect on future events.

example.ex: It was a fateful decision, one which was to break the Government.
example.tran: 这是一项将会让政府垮台的重大决定。

means.word_mean: 1. having momentous consequences; of decisive importance;

sentences.sentence: "that fateful meeting of the U.N. when...it declared war on North Korea"- Saturday Rev
"the fatal day of the election finally arrived"

means.word_mean: 3. (of events) having extremely unfortunate or dire consequences; bringing ruin;

sentences.sentence: "the stock market crashed on Black Friday"
"the battle was a disastrous end to a disastrous campaign"
"such doctrines, if true, would be absolutely fatal to my theory"- Charles Darwin
"it is fatal to enter any war without the will to win it"- Douglas MacArthur

means.word_mean: 4. controlled or decreed by fate; predetermined;

auth_sentence.content: Details of the Kuber's fateful voyage are emerging.
auth_sentence.res_content: Details of the Kuber's fateful voyage are emerging.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Details of the Kuber's fateful voyage are emerging.

auth_sentence.content: Here engineers made the fateful errors that poisoned the Earth.
auth_sentence.res_content: Here engineers made the fateful errors that poisoned the Earth.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Here engineers made the fateful errors that poisoned the Earth.

auth_sentence.content: That fatal summer and those fateful words continue to resonate.
auth_sentence.res_content: That fatal summer and those fateful words continue to resonate.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: That fatal summer and those fateful words continue to resonate.

Sentence.sentence: Decades ago, Kodak anticipated that digital photography would overtake film — and in fact, Kodak invented the first digital camera in 1975 — but in a fateful decision, the company chose to shelf its new discovery to focus on its traditional film business.

means.word_mean: 重大的,有很大影响的,引起灾难的,灾难性的

sentences.en: those killed in the hail of bullets fired on that fateful day
sentences.cn: 那个影响深远的日子里牺牲在枪林弹雨中的人

sentences.en: Seconds after uttering the fateful words ‘this is easy’, he crashed.
sentences.cn: 说了“这很容易”这句预言性的话后几秒钟，他的心脏就停止跳动。
